page.title: 09ST. PETER'S CHURCH, HENFIELD
page.content: There are several places of worship in Henfield. Within the Parish boundaries are two belonging to the Church of England. Both are called St. Peter's. St. Peter's Church, Henfield. The Church is quite old. It is built in the shape of a cross. Inside the Church there is a Children's Corner with a font. Every first Sunday in the month we have Church Parade, I attend this service as a Brownie. There is a large Bell-ringing gallery. The villagers are designing and making hassocks for the church. They show local flowers, animals and birds. They are very pretty. There is a very old chest in the Church. It had some very old documents in it. The Parish Magazine will be 100 years old in 1986. The Church is surrounded by yew trees. It is pretty.
